basics.name: Seonwoo Kim
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying Business Administration and Computer Science at Yonsei University, with interests in strategy, data analysis, and software-related problem solving.

education.area: Business Administration and Computer Science (Double Major)

work.summary: Supported consulting teams through industry research and data-related analysis.
highlights: Conducted research on the insurance industry, including market structure and competitive landscape analysis
Supported M&A-related research by reviewing industry trends and target company information
Performed data cleaning and preprocessing tasks to support internal analyses
Synthesized research findings to support consultants’ internal discussions

work.summary: Conducted market and regulatory research to support new business strategy projects.
highlights: Analyzed firestop market trends and contributed insights to client presentation materials
Researched U.S. fire protection regulations and certification requirements
Conducted industry research on battery recycling and marine navigation systems

activities.summary: Student-led management consulting organization at Yonsei University.
highlights: Participated in 10+ internal projects and 2 external corporate projects across diverse industries
Led a case study on the global TV industry, analyzing historical success factors and future strategic shifts
Conducted market research for a commercial due diligence project in the liquefied CO₂ market
Served as CRO, planning and coordinating major internal events to strengthen member engagement

activities.organization: EIC (Economic and Business Club by FKI)
activities.position: Member / CEO of Business Model Competition
activities.summary: Economics and business-focused student organization engaging in debates, competitions, and case analysis.
highlights: Led a 10-member team in a business model competition, developing a mentor-matching self-growth application
Won first place by proposing a scalable strategy addressing unmet user needs
Represented the organization in inter-club economic debates, earning top awards for persuasive argumentation
Participated in multiple programs including economic debates, mock investment, and corporate analysis

activities.organization: BizYON (Yonsei University School of Business Ambassador Program)
activities.summary: Student ambassador organization representing Yonsei University School of Business.
highlights: Led the organization as President, coordinating outreach programs with administrators and high schools
Relaunched a major outreach event paused during COVID-19, attracting over 1,000 applicants
Produced promotional video content and proposed integrated social media strategies to enhance engagement

awards.title: Honor Scholarship
awards.summary: Merit-based scholarship awarded for academic excellence during the 2022 academic year.

awards.title: 1st Place, Business Model Competition
awards.awarder: EIC (Economic and Business Club by FKI)
awards.summary: Awarded for developing a scalable business model addressing unmet user needs.

awards.title: 1st Place, Debate Competition
awards.summary: Won first place in an inter-club debate competition through structured argumentation and rebuttals.

awards.title: Business Class MVP
awards.summary: Recognized as the top-performing student in a business course.
